Interface_name: HTTP Client - side based on request in javascript
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a URL expander class that can recursively resolve shortened URLs from various URL shortening services by making HTTP requests to their respective APIs or following redirects.

Class Description: The URLExpander class provides functionality to expand shortened URLs by:
1. Maintaining a mapping of known URL shortening services
2. Using service-specific APIs when available
3. Falling back to generic HTTP HEAD requests to follow redirects
4. Preventing infinite loops through depth tracking and URL history

Attributes:
map: [Object] - A mapping of URL shortening services to their known domains
timeout: [Number] - HTTP request timeout in milliseconds (default: 5000)

Methods:
constructor() -> [URLExpander] - Initializes the URL expander with default configuration

expand: [Function](args: Object, callback: Function) -> [void] - Main method to expand a URL
- args: Object containing:
  - url: String - The URL to expand
  - depth: Number - Current recursion depth (optional)
  - seen: Object - Map of previously seen URLs (optional)
- callback: Function to receive the result with expanded args object

APIs: [Object] - Collection of service-specific expansion methods:
- isgd: [Function](args: Object, callback: Function) -> [void] - Expands is.gd URLs
- googl: [Function](args: Object, callback: Function) -> [void] - Expands goo.gl URLs
- budurl: [Function](args: Object, callback: Function) -> [void] - Expands budurl.com URLs
- snipurl: [Function](args: Object, callback: Function) -> [void] - Expands snipurl.com and related URLs
- generic: [Function](args: Object, callback: Function) -> [void] - Generic URL expansion using HTTP HEAD requests
